dxf2svg.svg
Class SvgHatchLine

java.lang.Object
  dxf2svg.svg.SvgElement
      dxf2svg.svg.SvgObject
          dxf2svg.svg.SvgGraphicElement
              dxf2svg.svg.SvgDoubleEndedGraphicElement
                  dxf2svg.svg.SvgLine
                      dxf2svg.svg.SvgHatchLine
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public final class SvgHatchLine
extends SvgLine

This class encapsulates a line element that is used expressly for hatch patterns. To that end this class implements features not found in SvgLine namely the introduction of dash elements a-la TableLineType.

Patterns exist in their own space in Svg. They are referenced into a drawing as a <pattern> element nested within a <defs> element, by way of a URL. A pattern line is essentially a <path> element because of its definition in DXF, but could in SVG be a circle or ellipse or what have you.

Version:
0.02 - August 13, 2004
Author:
Andrew Nisbet

Nested Class Summary
protected  class SvgHatchLine.DashArrayIndexOutOfRangeException
          This Runtime Exception gets thrown if there are more dashes than declared by group code (79) of the hatch pattern.
protected  class SvgHatchLine.NullParentPatternException
          This gets throw if an attempt to set the object's parent pattern is null.
 class SvgHatchLine.UnsetLinePatternDataException
          Gets thrown if data critical to the calculation of a hatch pattern line has not been set.

setDashLength

public void setDashLength(double len)
Populates an array of dash lengths which will form a dotted pattern. This method could be called repeatedly; once for each dash or space.

setParentPattern

public void setParentPattern(SvgHatchPattern pattern)
This method sets the bounding box for this object to the maximum for the pattern. The SvgHatchPattern object polls all of the lines in its pattern for bounding boxes and sets the size to the maximum for the entire pattern.

Throws:
SvgHatchLine.NullParentPatternException - if the parent pattern is null.

calculateMyUniqueData

protected java.lang.String calculateMyUniqueData()
Performs the unique calculation required to describe this object as an SVG element.

Overrides:
calculateMyUniqueData in class SvgLine

getBoundingBox

public double[] getBoundingBox()
Returns the width and height (in that order) of a box big enough (or small enough) to render this perticular pattern line.

Throws:
SvgHatchLine.UnsetLinePatternDataException - if the quadrant the line extends into has not been set. It is supposed to be set in calculateMyUniqueData()
